intro: Planchonella brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed pandanus, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its robust, woody structure and broad, fan-like leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that turns from green to yellow when mature. Planchonella brevipes is often found in coastal or lowland areas, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
